title: Mount Passel
text: Mount Passel () is a ridgelike <a href="mountain">mountain</a> 4 nautical miles (7 km) north of the <a href="Swanson%20Mountains">Swanson Mountains</a> in the <a href="Ford%20Ranges">Ford Ranges</a>, <a href="Marie%20Byrd%20Land">Marie Byrd Land</a>. <a href="Passel%20Pond">Passel Pond</a> lies at the southwest foot of the mountain. Discovered in December 1940 by members of a geological party of the <a href="United%20States%20Antarctic%20Service">United States Antarctic Service</a> (USAS) which visited this area, and named for <a href="Charles%20F.%20Passel">Charles F. Passel</a>, geologist and radio operator of that party.
